comments.author: maybelles mom
comments.content:
AAH, we were just talking about starting an Indian Dosa and Taco truck in Cleveland, b/c my husband has been laid off.
As to these potatoes delish.  i put up my sopes photos too and linked to that post.  great recipe.

comments.author: roopa
comments.content:
While not traditionally Indian, this is definitely a great Indian-inspired recipe.

On a slightly related note, I've been making Indian tacos for years, but unfortunately there are too many carnivores in the world for my vegetarian Indian tacos to really take off.  Sigh.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: @roopa and @mm - wow, two kindred spirits on the Indian tacos! Couple more and it could be a movement :).

comments.author: Alessandra
comments.content:
The red potatoes look good! I am not a vegan, just a veggie, I would add yogurt, on the side.
Good luck with the demo :-)

comments.author: Apeksha
comments.content:
You wife is right....they dont look like potatoes at first sight! :)

I love the addition of jalapenos to indian potatoes! I sometimes even add sweet jalapenos to my stir-fried potatoes......love the tangy-spicy flavor it gives!

comments.author: renee
comments.content:
I love dry fried Indian dishes! yum! We got started cooking them from a cookbook called Indian Vegetarian Cooking from an American Kitchen.

As for Indian Tacos, we have them here in New Mexico, they're just different, made by Native Americans and with big lumps of fry bread. Completely different flavors but called the same thing. But since I am GF, I haven't tasted them.

For a gluten free Indian Taco, I would make some dosa or idli's and put this in them with some yogurt.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Yes! I'd love a taco on fry bread, that sounds killer. Someone needs to open a fry bread stand in the Seattle.
